p: To confirm the role of NLRC5 in AIV replication, siRNA mediated NLRC5 knockdown (KD) was carried out in chicken macrophages. At 32 hpt, the NLRC5 levels were found to be approximately 50% lower in siRNA-treated cells as compared to the control transfection ( Figure 4A). The KD cells were next infected with the H5N2 LPAIV, H5N1 HPAIV or H7N2 LPAIV to observe the effect on virus production. NLRC5 KD cells showed significant reduction in virus replication compared to the wild type (scramble control) cells in both the H5N2 and H5N1 infections albeit to a greater level in the low pathogenicity H5N2 infection ( Figures 4B,C). Likewise, the corresponding viral titers in supernatants from KD cells infected with H5N2 and H7N2 were also decreased ( Figures 4D,E), confirming the role of NLRC5 in AIV replication and suggesting that NLRC5 could be a pro-viral host factor.
